item.title: Announcing State of the Map 2024 in Nairobi (and online) on 6-8 September 2024 https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2023/08/14/announcing-state-of-the-map-2024-september-6-to-8-2024-join-us-in-nairobi-and-online/ #OpenStreetMap #SotM cc: @openstreetmap

Hawa Adinani explains how contributing to #OpenStreetMap has transformed her: “We often talk about how OpenStreetMap contributes to various initiatives like disaster responses, urban planning, land use analysis, and research. However, I believe we’re not doing justice to OSM by not sharing how it has profoundly impacted our personal lives.” Read more at https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/Hawa%20Adinani/diary/402134.

#OpenStreetMap Belgium’s Mapper of the Month #MotM is @joost_schouppe. If the name sounds familiar to you, it might be for many reasons. It could be for his past involvement as OpenStreetMap Foundation #OSMF board member, for leading the Belgian community chapter, or being a very active mapper. Read the interview at https://openstreetmap.be/en/motm/2023/08/01/joost-schouppe.html. cc: @openstreetmap

Interesting paper from #MDPI about “Mapping with #ChatGPT” concludes it delivers unique advantages, such as: - lowering the barrier to producing maps - boosting the efficiency of massive map production - and understanding geographical space with its spatial thinking capability. Limitations cited are: - its unequal benefits for different users (need to have some expertise already) - and necessary user intervention for quality control. https://www.mdpi.com/2220-9964/12/7/284 cc: @openstreetmap

A nice comprehensive post explaining why State of the Map Conferences #SotM are so important to #OpenStreetMap: https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2023/07/07/why-state-of-the-map-conferences-are-so-important-to-osm/ Already attended one? Cc: @openstreetmap

For this #OpenStreetMap Belgium’s Mapper of the Month #MotM entry, the spotlight is on Michel Hebert from #Grenoble, France: https://openstreetmap.be/en/motm/2023/07/01/michel-hebert.html. He will probably be known by the people following @OsmGrenoble. Cc: @openstreetmap

OSM Relatify is a new web tool designed to simplify the process of editing public transport relations in #OpenStreetMap. A key feature is the smart routing logic to automatically construct bus routes from given bus stops and ways, taking into account factors like one-way streets and roundabouts. https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/NorthCrab/diary/401755 #OSMRelatify Screenshot of OSM Relatify, a tool to simplify editing public transport relations within OpenStreetMap

This month, the #OpenStreetMap Belgium’s Mapper of the Month #MotM is @zverik (Ilya), probably already known to you for his #Everydoor or #OSMCards projects (and a lot more, of course): https://openstreetmap.be/en/motm/2023/06/01/zverev.html.
What Android app would you recommend to convert geo coordinates in different formats? Ideally, Free software. #geocaching #FOSS #Android
Is there a public web tool to a draw circle on an #OpenStreetMap map to measure the straight-line distance between places?
The #OpenStreetMap Belgium series of Mapper of the Month #MotM interviews is home again with Jean-Louis Stanus: https://openstreetmap.be/en/motm/2023/05/01/jeanlouis-stanus.html.
A nice and comprehensive #OpenStreetMap How-To on “Mapping a turbo roundabout with #JOSM”: https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/Peter%20Elderson/diary/401459.

#OpenStreetMap mapper ivanbranco shares his list of favourite OSM-related tools/websites/apps: https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/ivanbranco/diary/401437. There are certainly some you’ll discover or rediscover.

A nice collection of free resources to learn #GIS (geographic information system) with #MOOC, self-guided learning, university courses, and more. https://www.gislounge.com/learn-gis-for-free/ #GISLounge

DIY Wi-Fi sensor, no programming, no soldering required. This project combines two ideas: no-code/low-code software platform and a quick, robust prototyping system that requires no soldering. https://galopago.github.io/english/wifi-sensor-nocode-nosoldering/ #Arduino #IoT #DIY #ESP32 #DS18B20 #I2C #ESPHome #Misistemita
TrickyFoxy mapper explains “Why you should try Every Door” to contribute to #OpenStreetMap: https://telegra.ph/Why-you-should-try-Every-Door-01-02 #EveryDoor (Edit: fix link)

Introducing the #Communities tab on #OpenStreetMap.org website. In the upper right corner of OSM.org, you can now see a “Communities” tab that links to a single, centralized location that lists formal Local Chapters, as well as the other OSM communities. https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2022/12/30/introducing-the-communities-tab-on-osm-org/

The #MapperDiaries channel on YT has an on-the-field video demo of #StreetComplete, so if you wondered what it takes in practice to contribute to #OpenStreetMap with it, you can see the live action. https://yewtu.be/watch?v=kjciqzv3Mwg

Searching for new people and content to follow? #Followgraph for Mastodon allows you to expand your network and find new people to follow. It works by looking up your "follows' follows". https://followgraph.vercel.app/

Nice article on how #OpenStreetMap editors efforts in #Australia have contributed a comprehensive dataset on sealed and unsealed road surfaces in New South Wales: https://little-maps.com/2022/12/16/openstreetmap-now-has-comprehensive-data-on-sealed-and-unsealed-roads-across-new-south-wales-australia/
